Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2011 09:52AM KiminSunnyFlorida wrote: Hi - I had an abnormal mammo with a cluster of calicifications which they thought were just calcium deposits and they wanted to do a needle biopsy to be sure.  I scheduled it and started the procedure laying on the uncomfortable table in a ridiculous position with your one boob through a hole in which they pulled and positioned it in order to take the x-ray, which they need before doing the actual needle biopsy.  It turns out that my breast is so dense and had many vessels in the area, they were not able to do it.   So, although I did not experience that, I will tell you this.  I had to have a surgical biopsy and it turned out to be DCIS (cancer contained within the milk duct) - they all said it's the best kind of cancer to have - blah, blah, blah.  I found out later that they should've ordered an MRI BEFORE doing any surgery - even the needle biopsy.  After being diagnosed, they then put me in surgery again - and like you, I wanted it OUT -rush, rush, rush.  Well, they tried and could not get clean margins - took 4 lymph nodes and closed me up - completely disfigured - so now I need a mastectomy.   I'm not trying to scare you, and I know you're a bit younger than me (I'm 52) - it is scary.  I'm seeing a plastic surgeon tomorrow that will help me decide on which reconstruction to have. Kim
